Package inra.ijpb.binary.distmap

Computations of distance maps on binary images, using chamfer distances (integer approximation of Euclidean distances).

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    DistanceTransform
    Interface for computing distance maps from binary images.
    DistanceTransform3D
    Interface for computing distance maps from binary 3D images.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    DistanceTransform3D4WeightsFloat
    Computes 3D distance transform in a 5x5x5 neighborhood using four chamfer weights and floating point calculation.
    DistanceTransform3D4WeightsShort
    Computes Chamfer distances in a 3x3x3 neighborhood using short point calculation.
    DistanceTransform3DFloat
    Computes Chamfer distances in a 3x3x3 neighborhood using floating point calculation.
    DistanceTransform3DShort
    Computes Chamfer distances in a 3x3x3 neighborhood using short point calculation.
    DistanceTransform3x3Float
    Computes Chamfer distances in a 3x3 neighborhood using a float array for storing result.
    DistanceTransform3x3Short
    Computes Chamfer distances in a 3x3 neighborhood using ShortProcessor object for storing result.
    DistanceTransform5x5Float
    Computes Chamfer distances in a 5x5 neighborhood using a FloatProcessor object for storing result.
    DistanceTransform5x5Short
    Computes Chamfer distances in a 5x5 neighborhood using a ShortProcessor object for storing result.

Package inra.ijpb.binary.distmap Description

Computations of distance maps on binary images, using chamfer distances (integer approximation of Euclidean distances).

Contains implementations for computation using shorts or float values, for 3x3 and 5x5 neighborhoods.

Example of use: 


        short[] shortWeights = ChamferWeights.CHESSKNIGHT.getShortWeights();
        boolean normalize = true;
        DistanceTransform dt = new DistanceTransform5x5Short(shortWeights, normalize);
        ImageProcessor result = dt.distanceMap(inputImage);
        // or:
        ImagePlus resultPlus = BinaryImages.distanceMap(imagePlus, shortWeights, normalize);
See Also:
BinaryImages.distanceMap(ImageProcessor, short[], boolean), BinaryImages.distanceMap(ImageProcessor, float[], boolean), DistanceTransform
